meanings.definition: A star that suddenly increases greatly in brightness because of a catastrophic explosion that ejects most of its mass.
meanings.sent1: Last night, we learned about a supernova in science class.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study supernovae to understand more about the universe.
meanings.sent3: When the supernova exploded, it lit up the sky like a giant firework.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a supernova, bright and infectious.
meanings.sent5: The supernova's glow was so intense, it could be seen from far away.

meanings.definition: The explosion of a star, possibly caused by gravitational collapse, during which the star's luminosity increases by as much as 20 magnitudes and most of the star's mass is blown away at very high velocity.
meanings.sent1: A supernova can release more energy than our sun will in its entire lifetime.
meanings.sent2: The supernova's explosion was so powerful, it sent shockwaves through space.
meanings.sent3: The supernova's blast was so loud, it woke up the entire galaxy.
meanings.sent4: The impact of the supernova was felt across the cosmos.
meanings.sent5: The supernova's aftermath left a trail of stardust in its wake.
